summary: A rework of the 14 NPC of the Underground Bathhouse. They now come with unique bodies and faces based on CBBE and UBP bodies. Different pubic hair styles that match their appachii hair styles and color. Some npc now have tattoos applied to their body as well. All meshes and textures are provided so no other mods are required.
descriptionHtml:
Game: Skyrim
Mod Name: Underground Bathhouse - Unique NPC rework
Author: Andragon
Version: 1.1

[b][size=5][color=#ff0000]This mod is no longer need for Underground Bathhouse Version 6+[/color][/size][/b]
as it is included in the main mod install file. Just use for older Versions.


[b]IMPORTANT:[/b]
This should not run together with the optional apachii hair file for the Underground Bathhouse. It has to be at least after it.

[b]Description:[/b]
A rework of the 14 NPC of the Underground Bathhouse. They now come with unique bodies and faces based on CBBE and UBP bodies. Different pubic hair styles that match their appachii hair styles and color. Some npc now have tattoos applied to their body as well. All meshes and textures are provided so no other mods are required besides the Underground Bathhouse of course ;)


[b]Changelog:[/b]

ver 1.1
- changes made that were required by version 5.0 of the bathhouse

ver 1.0
- initial release


[b]Required Files:[/b]
underground_bathhouse.esm - main file of [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/27361]Underground Bathhouse[/url]


[b]Installation:[/b]
Extract the Contents of the "Data" folder to, your skyrim\Data directory, (typically, C:\Programfiles\Steam\SteamApps\common\skyrim\Data)
Insure ub_npc_rework.esp, is turned on and that you disabled the optional apachii hair file from the Underground bathhouse mod
or
Use the NexusModManager to autoinstall. Make sure you disable the optional apachii hair file from the Underground bathhouse mod


[b]Uninstallation:[/b]
Remove;
ub_npc_rework.esp from the data Data folder or disable the mod in NexusModManager


[b]Known Issues:[/b]
Some npc got their weight changed. This might let you see a gap between body and head on old savegames. To fix this:
Press ^ to open the console with that npc in view. Click on the npc and type 'setnpcweight #' (# is a value between 1 and 100)
In rare cases this may cause bugs, which should be resolved by simply changing cells.


[b]Credits:[/b]
Caliente, for allowing me to use assets from "Calientes Female Body Mod Big Bottom Edition -CBBE-" [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/2666]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/2666[/url]
(Calientes extended credits, Thepal, Raiar, Exnem, Danariel, AluminumFoil, Phygit, & tktk1)
Dimon99, for allowing me to use assets from "DIMONIZED UNP female body" [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/6709]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/6709[/url]
(Dimon99s extended credits, Vectorcide, & Caliente)
